courses.description: As the first in a series of six language courses, this course invites students without prior knowledge of French to explore the basic features of the French language. Supported by audiovisual aids, students will receive intensive practice in spoken and written French through interactive class work, homework and online exercises. They will become familiar with the basic concepts of French grammar and learn how to interact in some simple everyday situations.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken FREN2000,2001,2050,3000,3001,3002,3050 or 3051
courses.learning_outcomes:
After taking this course, students are expected to:
(1) master the basic communication skills such as greeting somebody
(2) exchanging basic personal information with someone in a social gathering
(3) describing an object or a person, shopping.
courses.course_syllabus:
| ***Course Content:*** The course will cover the following 7 lessons of the textbook *Le nouveau* *Taxi 1*: lessons 1 – 7 | | |
| --- | --- | --- |
| ***Lesson*** | ***Speech acts*** | ***Grammar*** |
| ***Leçon 1*** Bienvenue! (Welcome!) | - Greeting (1) - Introducing oneself - Inquiring / Giving information: name & nationality | - Conjugation: - *être /* - *s’appeler* - Subject pronouns’ gender: 1. masculine vs feminine (il vs. elle) - The question word *qui* - Elision |
| ***Leçon 2*** Qui est-ce ? (Who is it?) | - Introducing someone: 1. - first name , family name 2. - profession 3. - address: city & country | - Noun group (1): 1. - definite article + noun - Noun’s gender: masculine vs. feminine - Adjective’s agreement: in gender & number - preposition + country/city |
| ***Leçon 3*** Ça va bien? (How are you?) | - Giving information about a person: - name, age, profession, address & phone number - greetings (2) - asking / giving / understanding basic personal information - Numbers 21 - 69 | - Irregular Verbs: *aller, avoir* - Possessive adjectives (1) - Indefinite articles - Interrogative adjectives (1) |
| ***Leçon 4*** Correspond@nce (Correspondence) | - Revision: lessons 1 - 3. Talk about taste and preferences - “La francophonie” (French speaking countries) | |
| ***Leçon 5*** Trouvez l’objet (Find the object) | - Describing a room and its objects - Indicating the location of an object - Locating an object | - Prepositions & prepositional phrases of place - Adverbs of place - Definite & Indefinite articles (2) - The French idiom: *Il y a* … - Sentence structure with *Qu’est-ce que* … |
| ***Leçon 6*** Portrait-robot (Photofit) | - Describing people & objects - Colors - Talking about color | - Stressed pronouns (1) - The verb *avoir* - The negative *particles ne … pas* - Adjectives’ agreement (with noun or pronoun) - Possessive Adjectives (2) |
| ***Leçon 7*** Shopping | - Describing objects (2) - Asking price - Describing an object - Clothes shopping - Filling an order-form | - Numbers : 70 - 1000 - Question word: *comment, combien* - Interrogative adjectives (2) - Demonstrative adjectives |
courses.feedback_evaluation: Our language programme highly values students’ feedback and comments and is happy to use them for reflection on our teaching and improvement. Students are very welcome to provide comments and feedback on the course any time to their course teacher or the course level coordinator through email or in personal conversation. In addition, students’ feedbacks will be collected in the middle of the term through an open-end questionnaire and the teacher will discuss the feedbacks in class and make improvements if necessary. The course will also follow the university’s course evaluation exercise at the end of the term, and students’ feedbacks will be used for future course planning and teaching.

• Textbook: Méthode de français Le nouveau Taxi 1, Ed. Hachette, Français Langue étrangère.
• Exercises book: Cahier d’exercices Le nouveau Taxi 1.
Information about how to get the textbook will be given in the first lesson.

courses.subject: FREN
courses.title: Invitation to French Online
courses.description:
[This course is offered via asynchronous online mode. Students should register the course via KEEP, a CUHK eLearning platform where the course materials are uploaded.]

This course is for students without prior knowledge of French to discover some aspects of the French culture along with some basic elements of the French language. With the support of audio-visual materials, short textual information, different interactive tasks and online tests, it aims to help students get familiar with practical and cultural aspects of daily life in a French-speaking environment. It serves as a taster for students who might consider taking three-unit or six-unit French courses offered by the French programme of CUHK in the future.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
Not for students who have taken FREN1000, 2000, 2001, 2050, 3000, 3001, 3002, 3050 or 3051
From 2023-24, students can only earn up to 2 units of these courses: CLCP1001,CLCP1101,CLCC1001,CLCC1101,JASP1350,HKSL1001,SPAN1001,GERM1001,KORE1001,FREN1001
courses.learning_outcomes:
Upon completion of the course, students are expected to be able to:
- understand some basic features of the French language.
- interact in simple French in daily contexts, e.g., greetings, ordering food in a restaurant, expressing preferences for the food, etc.
- learn French independently as part of their learning experience.
courses.course_syllabus:
| | **Language Components** | **Culture Components** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **Unit 1:*****Bienvenue à la résidence*** (Welcome to the residence) | - **Formal and informal expressions for greeting and closing conversations:** *Bonjour/ Salut/ Enchanté(e)/ Au revoir…* *(Hello/ Hi/ Nice to meet you/ Good bye…).* **- Being polite:** *S’il vous plaît/ Excusez-moi/ Merci/ Bienvenue.* *(Please/ Excuse me/ Thank you/ Welcome).* - **Formal and informal introductions:** *Comment vous vous appelez/ Comment tu t’appelles ?/ Et toi ?/ Tu viens d’où ?* *Etc.* *(What is your name?/* *And you?/ Where do you come from? etc.).* **- Grammar:** verbs S*’appeler/ Être (To call oneself/ To be)* **- Vocabulary:** *occupations.* | **Meeting people:** - Formal vs informal situations. |
| **Unit 2:** ***Bon appétit!*** (Enjoy your meal!) | **- Ordering food and the drink in a restaurant:** *- Je voudrais … s’il vous plaît (I would like to have …please)* *- Pour moi, … s’il vous plaît (For me, … please)* *Un thé / un café/une limonade / une bière / …* *(a (cup of) tea/ a (cup of) coffee/ a (glass of) lemonade/ a (glass of) beer/…)* **- Starting the meal:** *Bon appétit!* (*Enjoy your meal!)* **-Saying “Cheers” in French:** *Santé / À votre santé ! (Cheers!)* **- Asking the bill:** *- L’addition, s’il vous plaît! (The bill, please)* - **Expressing appreciation on food:** *C’est délicieux ! / c’est bon ! (It’s delicious!/ It’s good)* | **French-style meal:** *- Hors d'œuvre* *(*starter*)*, main course, drinks and wine, cheese, dessert. |
| **Unit 3:** ***On sort!*** (Let’s go out!) | **- Suggesting and choosing a place for cultural exposure:** *Un film ? Ça te dit ?* *(How about watching a movie?)* *Ou un musée ? (Or visiting a museum?)* **- Expressing appreciation**: *C’est beau!/ C’est magnifique**.* *(It’s beautiful/ It’s wonderful)* *J’aime beaucoup/Je préfère. (**I like it very much/ I prefer)* - **Agreeing/disagreeing with the suggestion:** *D’accord!/ J’adore la sculpture !* *(Okay!/ I love sculpture)* *- Oh là là, non, je déteste le rap ! (Oh dear, no, I hate hip hop!)* | **Introduction of two monuments and two museums of Paris:** - La tour Eiffel. - L’Arc de Triomphe. - Le Louvre. - Le musée Guimet. |
| **Unit 4:** **Au cinéma** (At the movies) | **- Choosing a movie:** *On va au cinéma?/* *Quel film ?/...* *(Let’s go to the movies?/ What film?/ ...)* **- Expressing simple attitudes and opinions: disappointment, excitement, boredom…** *Zut/ Quel dommage/ J’aime…/ Je n’aime pas…*/ *C’est super/ C’est nul…* *(Shoot/ What a pity/ I like…/ I don’t like…/ It’s great/ It sucks…)* ***-*** **Asking “how are you?”** *Comment ça va?/ Super bien/ Ça va…* *(How are you?/ Great/ I am OK…)* **- Introducing someone:** *Je te présente Stéphanie/ C’est qui ?...* *(This is Stéphanie/ Who is it?...)* **- Vocabulary: movie genres and adjectives to express positive and negative opinions.** *Une comédie/ Un film d’action…* *(A comedy/ An action movie…)* *Super/ Nul/Ennuyeux/ Belle…* *(Great/ Bad/ Boring/ Beautiful…)* | **Manners in public places:** - Speaking on the phone in a public place. - Interacting with a staff and strangers in a cinema. |
| **Unit 5:** ***Le club de sport*** (The sports club) | **- Requesting information at a sports club:** *Bonjour, c’est pour une inscription, s’il vous plaît.* *(Hello, it is for registration, please.)* *C’est pour le foot. (It is for soccer)* *Je voudrais des informations. (I would like some information)* *C’est combien ?* *(How much is it?)* **-Understanding some information given at a sports club:** *C’est gratuit pour les étudiants.* *(It is free for students.)* **-Understanding some questions frequently asked at a sports club:** *- C’est pour le tennis? (It is for tennis?)* *- Vous avez une photo ? C’est pour la carte de membre.* *(Do you have a photograph? It is for the membership card)* *- Vous avez une carte d’étudiant ?* *(Do you have a student card?)* **-Understanding some instruction given at a sports club:** *-Complétez ce formulaire, s’il vous plait.* *(Fill in this form, please.)* *-Inscrivez votre nom, votre prénom et votre adresse. (Write down your name, your first name and your address.)* | **Sports activities in France:** *le tennis, le foot and some other major types of sports in France.* **Manners in formal situation:** -Handing politely a document. -Expressing agreement. |
| **Unit 6 :** ***Bonnes fêtes*** **!** (Happy Holidays!) | *-***Introducing a person to a friend and thanking for an invitation:** *Voici un ami. (Here is a friend.) ; Je te présente.* *(I introduce (her/him) to you.);* *Enchanté (Nice to meet you)* *Merci pour l’invitation ! (Thanks for the invitation!);* *Avec plaisir ! (With pleasure!)* ***-*** **Asking questions about a holiday:** C’est comment, le Nouvel an en France ? *(How is New Year’s Day like in France?);* Et les activités ? *(And what about the activities?);* Et demain soir, tu vas où ? *(And tomorrow night, where do you go?);* La Saint-Valentin, en France, c’est quand ? *(Valentine’s Day, in France, when is it?);* Avec qui? *(With whom?)* Et on fait quoi? *(And what do we do?)* -**Talking about what people do in general (during a holiday)**: *On mange (We eat); on danse (we dance); on boit (we drink); on s’embrasse (we kiss each other); on va dans un bar (we go in a bar), on sort au restaurant pour un dîner en amoureux (we go out for a romantic dinner), etc.* | **Introduction of the New Year celebrations in France:** *the customs, the activities, the food and drinks and the greetings used during that event.* **Introduction of the celebration of Valentine’s Day:** *the date, the activities, the expression frequently used and the gifts frequently offered.* |

courses.subject: FREN
courses.title: Made in France
courses.description: This course is designed to present the French society and culture from a cross-cultural perspective. We will particularly examine the aspects of behavior, attitudes and customs of the French in modern France, as well as their image in the world.
courses.learning_outcomes:
After taking this course, students are expected to be able to:

(1) Analyze the main cultural traits of French.

(2) Globally understand the culture of contemporary France and to take a critical look on it.

courses.description: Building on the knowledge acquired in FREN1000, this course aims to further develop students’ ability to communicate in French in various everyday situations. It also seeks to give students a taste of French culture and invites them to explore cultural differences. Through intensive practice students will develop more confidence in interacting in French while further expanding and solidifying their understanding of the basic grammar and pronunciation patterns.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
1. Not for students who have taken FREN2001,2050,3000,3001,3002,3050 or 3051
2. Prerequisite: FREN1000
courses.learning_outcomes:
After taking this course, students are expected to:
(1) master the basic communication skills such as asking for direction or ordering food at a restaurant
(2) be able to traveling in a French speaking country, buying train or airplane tickets
(3) talking about one’s daily activities and habits, relating past events.
courses.course_syllabus:
| Course syllabus: The course will cover the following 8 lessons of the textbook Le Nouveau *TAXI 1*: lessons 10, 11, 13, 14, 15, 17, 18, 19. | | |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Lesson | Speech acts | Grammar |
| ***Leçon 10***: Pour aller au Louvre? (How to go to the Louvre ?) | - Asking the way: Direction & means of transportation. | - Sentence structure: The imperative mood. - Prepositions: - the contracted forms au , du - à & en + means of transportation. - Adverb of place: y |
| ***Leçon 11***: Voyages, voyages (Travel, travel) | - Situating a place on a map. - Giving advice. | - Expression: - C’est + Noun Group - C’est + Adjective - C’est + Adverbial of place - The Subject pronoun on. - Prepositions of place. |
| ***Leçon 13***: Vous partez quand ? (When are you leaving? ) | - Hours & Dates - Polite questions. | - Question with - Quand … ? - Quelle heure est-il ? - Verb : partir (present tense) |
| ***Leçon 14***: À Genève (At Geneva) | - Jobs and Professions. - Asking for information. | - Verb: faire (present tense) - Question structure with est-ce que - Gender of Noun. - Verb: *faire* (present tense) - Question structure with *est-ce que* - Gender of Noun.- Verb: faire (present tense) - Question structure with est-ce que - Gender of Noun. |
| ***Leçon 15***: Le dimanche matin (Sunday morning) | - What one is doing. - What one is used to do. - Sports. | - Verbs: lire, écrire (present tense) - Verbes pronominaux (Part I) - Le dimanche / dimanche prochain. |
| ***Leçon 17***: Mardi gras | - Expressions of need. - Talking about habitude. - Expressions of quantity | - Partitive articles: du, de la, de l’ - Verbs: - boire, acheter & manger (present tense) |
| ***Leçon 18***: Une bonne journée (A good day) | - Talking about past events (I) - Giving personal opinion. - Paying compliments. | - The tense Passé composé (I) with auxiliary verb avoir. - Basic forms of the past participle in French. - Agreement of Adjective : beau |
| ***Leçon 19*** : Où sont-ils allés ? (Where have they been ?) | - Talking about past events (II) - Expressions of duration. | - The tense Passé composé (II) with auxiliary verb être. - Markers of time. |

courses.description: This course aims to further enhance students’ communication skills in the four language domains listening, speaking, reading and writing. Students are expected to communicate confidently in a wider range of social interactions including more formal situations and simple professional contexts as well as reporting past events and sharing experience. At the end of this course, students will have completed a proficiency level comparable to level A1 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFR).
courses.enrollment_requirement:
1. Not for students who have taken FREN3000,3001,3002,3050 or 3051
2. Prerequisite: FREN2000 or FREN2050
courses.learning_outcomes: After taking this course, the student is expected to be able to express his/her opinion about simple issues or to express objections, to give advice or to make suggestions. He/she would know how to behave and interact in a situation related to work such as looking for a job, asking for information about a job advertisement, attending a job interview, speaking with colleagues, etc. On the other hand, the student should be capable to speak about holidays, activities during days off and leisure time.
courses.course_syllabus:
| ***Course Content:*** The course will cover the following 6 lessons of the textbook *Le nouveau* *TAXI 1*: lessons 21 – 27 | | |
| --- | --- | --- |
| ***Lesson*** | ***Speech acts*** | ***Grammar*** |
| **Leçon 21** *C’est interdit!* *(It is prohibited!)* | - Asking for permission: - Accepting / Refusing - Expressions of prohibition | - Verb: *pouvoir* + verb 2 - The indirect object pronouns - Imperative + Negative |
| **Leçon 22** *Petites annonces.* *(Classified.)* | - Talking about capability & will - Talking about obligation | - Verbs: *vouloir, savoir* - The impersonal verb: *falloir* : *Il faut* *-* Expressing future events : *futur proche* |
| **Leçon 23** *Qu’est-ce qu’on lui offre?* *(What should we give her?)* | - Making suggestions : - Accepting / Refusing | - Verbs: c*onnaître* - Direct object pronouns. - Indirect object pronouns. |
| **Leçon 25** *Enquête.* *(Report.)* | -Expressing likes & dislikes - Expressing frequency - Expressing intensity | - Pronouns: *en, ça* - The negative form: *ne … plus* |
| **Leçon 26** *Quitter Paris.* *(Leaving Paris.)* | - Expressing opinions - Expressing objections | - The question word: *pourquoi* - The conjunctive phrase: *parce que / parce qu’…* - Adv. of intensity + Adj.: *assez / trop* + adjective - Expression of quantity + Noun : *assez de / trop de* + Noun - Adj.: *Tout / toute / tous / tous* - Pronouns: *tous / toutes* |
| **Leçon 27** *Vivement les vacances!* *(Can’t wait for holiday!)* | - Expressing appreciation / depreciation - Giving advice | - Verbes pronominaux: \**se lever.* \*position of the reflexive pronoun in imperative mood |

meetings.instructor: Mr Raphael Ange Francois A. CHIARELLI
Mr Raphael Ange Francois A. CHIARELLI
Mr Raphael Ange Francois A. CHIARELLI

courses.description: This course is an introduction to the phonetic system of the French language. Illustrations and examples will be taken from modern spoken French. Similarities and differences to other languages will also be examined when appropriate. Students learning French are encouraged to take this course.
courses.course_syllabus:
• Types of Speech sound in modern French (International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA)):

- Vowel,

- Consonant,

- Semi-vowel,

- Phonemes,

- Distinctive features and minimal pair.

• French Syllable:

- Syllable structures (open syllable/close syllable),

- Syllabification and syllable boundary,

- Vowel clusters/Consonant clusters,

- Final letter: final consonant; final /e/ (Schwa [ә]).

• French Syllable & Rhythmic groups:

- Pronunciation of numbers,

- Enchaînement,

- Liaison: obligatoire, interdite, facultative,

- Elision,

- [ә] caduc.

• Intonation patterns:

- Pitch,

- Stress,

- Duration.

• If time allows:

- Expressive intonation patterns,

- Usual foreign words.

All through the term, spoken and written French will be used (dialogues, rhymes, poem, prose…).

courses.title: French I & II
courses.description: (Please read the Study Scheme Note.) This is a summer intensive French language course for beginners, covering the full syllabus of FREN1000 and 2000.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken FREN1000,2000,2001,3000,3001,3002,3050 or 3051
courses.learning_outcomes: The student should be able to express his/her opinion about simple issues or to express objections, to give advice or to make suggestions. He/she would learn how to behave and interact in a situation related to work such as looking for a job, asking for information about a job advertisement, attending a job interview, speaking with colleagues, etc., and also be capable to speak about holidays, activities during days off and leisure time, to tell about his/her childhood and any other story in the past tense. Moreover, he/she will be expected to be able to understand an event mentioned in a newspaper or on the radio and to report it again. In the end, he/she should be capable to make plans, to propose conditions and to express intention and certitude as well as eventuality.
courses.course_syllabus:
| Course syllabus: The course will cover the following 16 lessons of the textbook *LE NOUVEAU* *TAXI 1*: lessons 1-7, 9-11, 13-15, 17-19 | | |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Lesson | Speech acts | Grammar |
| ***Leçon 1:*** Bienvenue! *(Welcome!)* | - Greeting (1) - Introducing oneself - Inquiring / Giving information: name & nationality | - Conjugation: - *être /* - *s’appeler* - Subject pronouns’ gender: 1. masculine vs feminine (il vs. elle) - The question word *qui* - Elision |
| ***Leçon 2:*** Qui est-ce ? *(Who is it?)* | - Introducing someone: 1. - first name , family name 2. - profession - address: city & country | - Noun group (1): 1. - definite article + noun - Noun’s gender: masculine vs. feminine - Adjective’s agreement: in gender & number - preposition + country/city |
| ***Leçon 3:*** Ça va bien? *(How are you?)* | - Giving information about a person: - name, age, profession, address & phone number - greetings (2) - asking / giving / understanding basic personal information - Numbers 21 - 69 | - Irregular Verbs: *aller, avoir* - Possessive adjectives (1) - Indefinite articles - Interrogative adjectives (1) |
| ***Leçon 4:*** Correspond@nce *(Correspondence)* | - Revision: lessons 1 - 3. Talk about taste and preferences - “La francophonie” (French speaking countries) | - Verb: *faire* (present tense) - Question structure with *est-ce que* - Gender of Noun.- Verb: faire (present tense) - Question structure with est-ce que - Gender of Noun. |
| ***Leçon 5:*** Trouvez l’objet *(Find the object)* | - Describing a room and its objects - Indicating the location of an object - Locating an object | - Prepositions & prepositional phrases of place - Adverbs of place - Definite & Indefinite articles (2) - the Verb: *être* - The French idiom: *Il y a* … - Sentence structure with *Qu’est-ce que* … |
| ***Leçon 6******:*** Portrait-robot (*Photofit*) | - Describing people & objects - Colors - Talking about color | - Stressed pronouns (1) - The verb *avoir* - The negative *particles ne … pas* - Adjectives’ agreement (with noun or pronoun) - Possessive Adjectives (2) |
| ***Leçon 7:*** Shopping | - Describing objects (2) - Asking price - Describing an object - Clothes shopping - Filling an order-form | - Numbers : 70 - 9,999 - Question word: *comment,* *combien* - Interrogative adjectives (2) - Demonstrative adjectives |
| ***Leçon 9:*** Appartement à louer *(Appartment for rent)* | - Inquiring / Giving information on a place - Requesting / giving information on a flat (or house) for rent (or for sale) - Describing a flat | - Stressed pronouns (2) - Prepositions & prepositional phrases of place - Prepositions*: avec, pour* - Question with *où* |
| ***L******eçon 10***: C’est par où? *(How to get there?)* | *-* Asking the way: Direction & means of transportation. | - Sentence structure: The imperative mood. - Prepositions: - the contracted forms *au , du* - *à & en* + *means of transportation.* - Adverb of place: *y* |
| ***L******eçon 11***: Bon voyage ! *(Have a good trip!)* | - Situating a place on a map. - Giving advice. | - Expression: *- C’est* + Noun Group *- C’est* + Adjective *- C’est* + Adverbial of place - The Subject pronoun *on.* - Prepositions of place. |
| ***L******eçon 13***: Un aller simple *(One-way trip)* | - Hours & Dates - Polite questions. | - Question with - *Quand* … ? - *Quelle heure est-il ?* - Verb : *partir* (present tense) |
| ***L******eçon 14***: À Londres *(In London)* | - Jobs and Professions. - Asking for information. | - Verb: *faire* (present tense) - Question structure with *est-ce que* - Gender of Noun. |
| ***L******eçon 15***: Le dimanche matin *(Sunday morning)* | *-* What one is doing. - What one is used to do. - Sports. | - Verbs: *lire, écrire* (present tense) - Verbes pronominaux (Part I) - *Le dimanche / dimanche prochain.* |
| ***L******eçon 17***: On fait des crêpes ? *(Do we make crêpes?)* | *-* Expressions of need. - Talking about habitude. - Expressions of quantity. | - Partitive articles: *du, de la, de l’* - Verbs: - *boire, acheter & manger* (present tense) |
| ***L******eçon 18***: Il est comment ? *(How is it ?)* | - Talking about past events (I) - Giving personal opinion. - Paying compliments. | - The tense *Passé composé* (I) with auxiliary verb *a**voir.* - Basic forms of the past participle in French. - Agreement of Adjective : *beau* |
| ***L******eçon 19*** : Chère Léa… *(Dear Léa…)* | - Talking about past events (II) - Expressions of duration. | - The tense *Passé composé* (II) with auxiliary verb *être.* *-* Markers of time |

courses.subject: FREN
courses.title: Exploring French Literature
courses.description:
This course is aimed at giving students a better understanding of the specificity of the French literary culture from the 16th to the 20th century. It aims at enriching the student’s general knowledge of French literature, allowing them to explore the writings of selected famous French authors through the centuries. A presentation of the socio-intellectual, historical and literary context of each century’s French literature will be provided. Through short excerpts of French works, we will explore how the literary works mirror and transform the social and intellectual ideas of their time, while also examining their innovative literary aspects. The emphasis will be put on the appreciation of the texts and the use of basic reading strategies. Students will be exposed to a group of selected works through multimedia such as movies, voice recordings, and visual illustrations.
Prior knowledge in French is not required for this course.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Upon the completion of this course, students will be able to:
• place authors and literary texts in their cultural and historical context.
• get an overview of the main literary trends in the history of French literature across different centuries.
• recognize the major elements of the literary genres, such as poetry, novel, and drama, and assess their significance.
• analyze texts from different genres (novel, poetry, drama).
• comprehend and respond to the French literary works with a heightened cultural awareness.
courses.course_syllabus:
| **Course Syllabus** | | |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Unit | Topic | Contents |
| 1 | The Sixteenth-century: Humanism and the Reformation. Poetry, stories & essays. | * François Rabelais: *Gargantua*, Chapter 57, 1534. (novel) * Pierre de Ronsard: *Ode to Cassandra, I, 17,* in *Les Amours, 1553.* (poem) * Louise Labé: *Je vis, je meurs* (*I live, I die*), Sonnet, 1555. (poem) * Michel de Montaigne: *Essays*, Livre IIII, Chapitre VI, 1588. (essay) |
| 2 | The Seventeenth-century: Baroque, preciousness, & classicism. Theatre & moralistic writing. | * Molière, *The Miser*, act III, scene 4, 1637. (play) * Jean de La Fontaine: *The Grasshopper and the Ant*, Book I, fable 1, 1668 (poem) * Jean de la bruyère : *Characters*, 1688. (writings) * Madame de la Fayette : *The Princess of Cleves*, 1678. (novel) |
| 3 | The Eighteenth-century: The Enlightenment and the Encyclopedia. Stories, essays & theater. | * Voltaire: *Candide*, 1759. (novel) * Denis Diderot: Rameau’s nephew, 1762. (essay) * Pierre de Choderlos de Laclos: Dangerous Liaisons, Letter IX, 1782. (novel) * Beaumarchais: *The Marriage of Figaro*, Act I, scene 1, 1784. (play) |
| 4 | The Nineteenth-century: Romanticism, realism and naturalism. Novel & poetry. | * Alphonse de Lamartine: *The Lake*, in *Poetical Meditations*, 1820. (poem) * Stendhal: *The Red and The Black*, Chapter 6, 1830. (novel) * Charles Baudelaire: *The Stranger*, I, in *Paris Spleen*, 1862. (poem) * Emile Zola: *Germinal*, Chapitre I, 1885. (novel) |
| 5 | The Twentieth-century: Existentialism, the absurd, women and literature. Theatre, novel & autobiography. | * Albert Camus: *The Stranger*, 1942. (novel) * Jean-Paul Sartre: *No Exit*, scene 5, 1844. (theater) * Samuel Becket: *Waiting for Godot*, act II, 1953. (play) * Simone de Beauvoir: *Memoirs of a Dutiful Daughter*, 1958.(autobiography) |

courses.description: This course aims at increasing students’ communicative fluency in oral and written French. Using a variety of classroom activities and multimedia, students will build up their competence in the four language domains listening, speaking, reading and writing. Through intensive practice they will be able to communicate in a wide range of social situations with the appropriate awareness of the pragmatic rules involved. Students receive guidance in the process of composing longer texts displaying a range of registers and styles relating to past, present and future events.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
1. Not for students who have taken FREN3001,3002,3050 or 3051
2. Prerequisite: FREN2001
courses.learning_outcomes: The student should be able to tell about his/her childhood and any other story in the past tense. Moreover, he/she will be expected to be able to understand an event mentioned in a newspaper or on the radio and to report it again. In the end, he/she should be capable to make plans, to propose conditions and to express intention and certitude as well as eventuality.
courses.course_syllabus:
| Course Content: The course will cover the following 6 lessons of the textbook *TAXI 2*: lessons 11,14,19,21,25,27 | | |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Lesson | Speech acts | Grammar |
| **Leçon 29** *Enfant de la ville* (City Child) | - Talking about a recent events - Talking about events and habits in the past | - Passé récent : venir de + inf. - Form of the imparfait tense |
| **Leçon 30** *Fait divers* (News in Brief) | - Talking about events and states of mind in the past. - Describing circumstances.. | - Form and use of passé composé and imparfait - Differences about the two tenses. |
| **Leçon 31** *Ma première histoire d’amour* (My First Love Story) | - Locating events in the time. - Expressing purposes : Goals & objectives. | - Dates, moment and duration. - The use of the preposition *pour* + inf. - Past participles. |
| **Leçon 32** *La 2CV… et autres symboles.* (2CV car… and other symbols) | Revision | |
| **Leçon 33** *Beau Fixe* (Nice Weather) | - Talking about weather. - Expressing eventuality & certitude. | - Tense : Le futur (simple) |
| **Leçon 34** *Projets d’avenir* (Projects about the Future) | - Making projects. - Locating events in the time. | - Tenses for denoting future events : présent , futur proche , futur simple - Adverbs & adverbial phrases of time for future events. |
| **Leçon 35** *Envie de changement* (Willing to Change) | - Making conditions. - Expressing one’s intention. | - Hypothesis & condition with si - quand + future tense. - Other irregular verbs in future tense. |
| **Leçon 36** *Le pain, mangez-en !* (Eat Bread!) | Revision | |

courses.subject: FREN
courses.title: French V
courses.description: This course focuses on the further development of communication skills in French with emphasis on the expression of personal views and the training of argumentative strategies. The course will also engage students in critical reflections on various aspects of life in French-speaking countries and their own social environment. Students will be guided to analyze various types of data to support their views. They will learn how to express their wishes and aspirations using the appropriate registers.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
1. Not for students who have taken FREN3002 or 3051
2. Prerequisite: FREN3000 or 3050
courses.learning_outcomes:
After taking this course, the student is expected to be able to :
• Talk about their life, their tastes, share their experiences.
• Make projects and talk about their objectives.
• Describe and compare their living environment.
• Explain problems and issues, give advice, suggest solutions and make hypothesis.
courses.course_syllabus:
| ***Course Content:*** The course will cover the following 5 lessons of the textbook *Echo 2* lessons 1,2,4,6,7. | | |
| --- | --- | --- |
| ***Lesson*** | ***Speech acts*** | ***Grammar*** |
| ***Leçon 1*** *Vivement demain !* *(Can’t wait for tomorrow!)* | - Make projects and suggestions. - express concerns and reassure people. - make comparisons . | - Revision of tense: future. - Comparative. - Superlative. |
| ***Leçon 2*** *Tu as du boulot ?* *(Do you have a job ?)* | - Express one’s taste and preference. - Make suppositions. | -Pronoun : *en.* -Pronoun : *y.* *-*Expressions of condition. Negative questions + *si / non*. |
| ***Leçon 4*** *C’est tout un programme !* *(Such a programm !)* | - Choose a TV programm and give opinion. - Give instructions. - Welcome someone. | - Relative pronouns : *qui/que/où.* - Adverbes. - « en + participe présent ». |
| + if time allows : Revision and Extras. | |
| ***Leçon 6*** *C’est la fête !* *(Let’s party !)* | - Express one’s taste. - Talk about parties and festivals. - Meet again - Approach someone. | - Revision COI/COD. - Agreement of past participle. |
| **Leçon 7** *Vous plaisantez !* *(Are you kidding ?)* | - Formulate hypotheses. -Suggest something and react to a suggestion. - Talk about movements. | -Tense: Conditionnal Present. -Conditionnal Present/ *Si+imparfait.* |
| + if time allows : Revision and Extras. | |

courses.subject: FREN
courses.title: French VI
courses.description: This course builds on the knowledge acquired through previous French language courses. It aims at leading students to a proficiency level comparable to the threshold from A2 to B1 of the Common European Framework for Languages (CEFR), becoming “independent users” of French. To achieve this goal, students will be encouraged to work project-based through independent or collaborative work with their peers. At the end of this course students will have mastered the most important grammar features of French and be able to communicate effectively in a wide range of everyday situations and a number of professional contexts. They will be able to use their oral and written language skills to relate to, reflect on and analyze past and current issues involving the French-speaking societies.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
1. Not for students who have taken FREN3051 
2. Prerequisite: FREN3001
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students will learn how to :
• gives advises and suggestions.
• express opinions and feelings.
• talk about leisure activities and justify the choice.
• talk about a trip and past experience.
courses.course_syllabus:
| Course Content: The course will cover the following 6 lessons of the textbook *TAXI 2*: lessons 11,14,19,21,25,27 | | |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Lesson | Speech acts | Grammar |
| **Leçon 11** *Demain, j’arrête …* *(tomorrow I stop)* | - Talking about goals - Giving advise, suggesting solutions | - Devoir + V. infinitif -Tense: subjonctive |
| ***Leçon 27*** *Questions de valeur* *(questions of values)* | - expressing and qualifying one’s feelings | - revision of the subjonctive present - expressions using subjunctive and infinitive |
| **Leçon 14** **A mi-temps** **(Half time)** | - Expressing a restriction | - Adverb using <ment> - Negation ( lesson 17) |
| ***Leçon 19*** *Destination week-end* *( destination for weekend)* | - Talking about one’s leisure activities | - Gerund -expressions of chronological difference between 2 actions ( lesson 30) -en train de + V.infinitif |
| ***Leçon 21*** *Heureux, qui comme Ulysse…* *(happy like Ulysse)* | - telling a story using past tense - talking about a trip, past experience… | - passé compose (revision) - passé compose “avoir”: ageement of the past participle |
| ***Leçon 25*** *Réussir sa vie* *(succeed one’s life)* | - report a speech, questions, and answers - taking stock of one s life | - indirect speech / present tense |

courses.subject: FREN
courses.title: French Conversation
courses.description: This course aims to enhance students’ oral communication skills in French. Through selected student-oriented stimuli and topics related to social issues and contemporary affairs, students will practice the expression and exchange of personal views and ideas. Classroom activities may include in-class activities such as dialogue, role-play, narration, speech, group discussion, debate and multimedia activities. Emphasis will be placed on oral practice and an interactive learning environment with a view to helping students build confidence and develop fluency in using the language, to speak spontaneously in social interaction and acquire conversational techniques commonly used in a French-speaking environment.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students will learn how to :
•Improve your ability to engage in spontaneous oral discussion on basic themes and to respond appropriately in context-specific conversational settings
•Expand and personalize your active vocabulary knowledge in common areas of conversation
•Improve your listening comprehension skills and further your ability to understand spoken language
courses.course_syllabus:
Les âges de la vie ( Ages of the life)
Le mensonge ( Lies)
La publicité ( Advertising)
Le bonheur ( Happiness)
Le progrès ( Progresse)
L’amitié ( Friendship)
La superstition ( Superstition)

courses.subject: FREN
courses.title: French Reading and Creative Writing
courses.description: This course is designed for students who study French and want to enhance their reading and writing skills through literary texts and excerpts. The emphasis will be placed on the reading of French texts and poems which lead to creative writings in French. The objective of the course is to equip students with language keys to comprehend the texts and subsequently produce creative texts in French. All texts are in French.
courses.learning_outcomes:
After taking this course, students are expected to:
- be able to use French pronunciation.
- be able to recognize and use the narrative tense.
- be able to create a variety of texts in French.

courses.subject: FREN
courses.title: Business French I
courses.description: This course is designed to introduce and train in active practice in a wide range of business related dialogues, as well as to acquire the basic skills of business terminology through the reading of short commercial documents.
courses.learning_outcomes:
After taking this course, students are expected to:
- to be able to use common communication professional tools.
- make individual projects or team project in professional situation.
- acquire stronger confidence to talk in front of formal audience.
- describe and compare companies’ organizational structure.
Students will be given tools to speak about various topics such as Motivation letter, CV Video, economic situation, formal company documents, professional presentation, job interview, French around the world.
courses.course_syllabus:
| **Course Content :** | | | |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| **Lesson** | **Speech Acts** | **Topic & Culture** | **Activity** |
| **Leçon 1** *Introduction* *–* *Cap sur l**’**entreprise* *(Introduction* *–**Towards Company !)* M1 p.7-18 | - Professional contacts - Introducing yourself - Describing a product - Understanding a product dealing network. | -Greetings. - Using “tu/vous”. | Export French Textiles. |
| **Leçon 2** *La communication professionnelle* *(Professional communication)* M2 p.19-30 | - Making a phone call and leaving a message. - Confirming order with a formal mail. - Making an appointment | - Business Trip communication - French companies | Retain your customers. |
| **Leçon 3** *Partez en déplacement !* *(Business trip!)* U4 p.59-73 | - Choosing an hotel and book a room - Choosing and buy a train/airplane ticket - Finding the hotel on the map/ on the road | - Phone in France. - Transportations in France. | Professional fees reimbursement. |
| **Leçon 4** *La visite d**’**un client* *(A customer**’s* *visit!)* M3 p.31-42 | - Welcoming a client. - Company introduction/visit. - Creating and managing a planning. - Speaking in public / holding a meeting. | - Meeting in France. - French company organization. | TV investigation on French major companies. |
| **Leçon 5** *Trouver un emploi* *(Finding a Job)* U8 p.126-139 | - Describing a job. - Describing job competences and professional skills for a job. - Talking about job experiences. - Negotiating job conditions. | - Job environment in France. | Cover letter. |
| **Leçon 6** *Missions et cadre de travail* *(Missions and Framework)* M7 p.80-90 | - Creating a French resume. - Applying for a job. - Understanding a working contract. - Having a job Interview. | - Working in French Companies. | Intern communication : le bulletin d’information d’entreprise. - Personal Work : create a personal video resume. |
| **Leçon 7** *Une commande ferme* *(Final order)* M4 p.43-54 | - Negotiating a price. - Using an order catalogue. - Placing an order by phone. - Placing an order on Internet. | - Placing an order in France. | Sales online : *vente en ligne.* |
| **Leçon 8** *Faites le bon choix !* *(Make the right choice !)* U6 p.91-139 | - Describing a dish? - Making a choice. - Describing a place/location. - Ordering in a restaurant. | - Marketing in France. - French cuisine. | “Les français à table : *French cuisine*”. - Progress workshop of Personal Work : create a personal video resume. |
| **Leçon 9** *Le compte est bon* *(Total is good)* M6 p.67-77 | - Understanding an invoice. - Making a phone call for late payment. - Understanding different payments tool. - Understanding a company balance sheet. | - French compagnies types (EURL, SARL, SA, SNC, GIE, SEM). | “Rationalize the invoice : *rationaliser la facturation*”. |

courses.subject: FREN
courses.title: French III & IV
courses.description: This is a summer intensive French language course, covering the full syllabus of FREN2001 and 3000.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
1. Not for students who have taken FREN2001,3000,3001,3002 or 3051
2. Prerequisite: FREN2000 or 2050
courses.learning_outcomes: The student should be able to express his/her opinion about simple issues or to express objections, to give advice or to make suggestions. He/she would learn how to behave and interact in a situation related to work such as looking for a job, asking for information about a job advertisement, attending a job interview, speaking with colleagues, etc., and also be capable to speak about holidays, activities during days off and leisure time, to tell about his/her childhood and any other story in the past tense. Moreover, he/she will be expected to be able to understand an event mentioned in a newspaper or on the radio and to report it again. In the end, he/she should be capable to make plans, to propose conditions and to express intention and certitude as well as eventuality.
courses.course_syllabus:
| Course syllabus: The course will cover the following 16 lessons of the textbook *LE NOUVEAU* *TAXI 1*: lessons 21 - 36. | | |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Lesson | Speech acts | Grammar |
| **Leçon 21** *C’est interdit !* *(It is prohibited!)* | - Asking for permission: - Accepting / Refusing - Expressions of prohibition | - Verb: *pouvoir* + verb 2 - The indirect object pronouns - Imperative + Negative |
| **Leçon 22** *Petites annonces.* *(Classified.)* | - Talking about capability & will - Talking about obligation | - Verbs: *vouloir, savoir* - The impersonal verb: *falloir* : *Il faut* *-* Expressing future events : *futur proche* |
| **Leçon 23** *Qu’est-ce qu’on lui offre ?* *(What should we give her?)* | - Making suggestions : - Accepting / Refusing | - Verbs: c*onnaître* - Direct object pronouns. - Indirect object pronouns. |
| **Leçon 24** *Le candidat idéal.* *(The best applicant.)* | - Giving advice & guidance | - Revision - Verb: *faire* (present tense) - Question structure with *est-ce que* - Gender of Noun.- Verb: faire (present tense) - Question structure with est-ce que - Gender of Noun. |
| **Leçon 25** *Enquête.* *(Report.)* | -Expressing likes & dislikes - Expressing frequency - Expressing intensity | - Pronouns: *en, ça* - The negative form: *ne … plus* |
| **Leçon 26** *Quitter Paris.* *(Leaving Paris.)* | - Expressing opinions - Expressing objections | - The question word: *pourquoi* - The conjunctive phrase: *parce que / parce qu’…* - Adv. of intensity + Adj.: *assez / trop* + adjective - Expression of quantity + Noun : *assez de / trop de* + Noun - Adj.: *Tout / toute / tous / tous* - Pronouns: *tous / toutes* |
| **Leçon 27** *Vivement les vacances !* *(Can’t wait for holiday!)* | - Expressing appreciation / depreciation - Giving advice | - Verbes pronominaux: \**se lever.* \*position of the reflexive pronoun in imperative mood |
| **Leçon 28** *Les Français en vacances.* *(French people on holidays)* | - Activities on holiday | - Revision |
| **Leçon 29** *Enfant de la ville* *(City Kid)* | - Talking about a recent events - Talking about events and habits in the past | - Passé récent : *venir de* + inf. - Form of the *imparfait* tense |
| **Leçon 30** *Fait divers.* *(News in Brief)* | - Talking about events and states of mind in the past. - Describing circumstances. | - Form and use of *passé composé* and *imparfait* - Differences about the two tenses. |
| **Leçon 31** *Ma première histoire d’amour* *(My first Love Story)* | - Locating events in the time. - Expressing purposes : Goals & objectives. | - Dates, moment and duration. - The use of the preposition *pour* + inf. - Past participles. |
| **Leçon 32** *La 2CV… et autres symboles.* *(2CV car… and other symbols)* | Revision | |
| **Leçon 33** *Beau Fixe* *(Nice Weather)* | - Talking about weather. - Expressing eventuality & certitude. | - Tense : *Le futur (simple)* |
| **Leçon 34** *Projets d’avenir* *(Projects for the Future)* | - Making projects. - Locating events in the time. | - Tenses for denoting future events : *présent, futur proche, futur simple* * Adverbs & adverbial phrases of time for future events. |
| **Leçon 35** *Envie de changement* *(Willing to Change)* | - Making conditions. - Expressing one’s intention. | - Hypothesis & condition with: *si + present, future* - Moment: *quand* + future tense. - Other irregular verbs in future tense. |
| **Leçon 36** *Le pain, mangez-en !* *(Eat Bread!)* | Revision | |

courses.subject: FREN
courses.title: French V & VI
courses.description: This is a summer intensive French language course, covering the full syllabus of FREN3001 and 3002.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
1. Not for students who have taken FREN3001 or FREN3002
2. Prerequisite: FREN3000 or FREN3050
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students will learn how to :
• talk about their life, past and present, share their experiences, tell a simple story
• make projects and talk about their objectives.
• explain problems and issues, give advice, suggest solutions and make hypothesis.
• describe and compare their living environment
Students will be given tools to speak about various topics such as; job history, health, accommodation hunt, urban environment, style et fashion. They will also learn how to organize efficiently their speech, describe places and people, present a project, report a speech, information and news, and take stock of their life.
courses.course_syllabus:
| Course syllabus: The course will cover the following 14 lessons of the textbook *TAXI 2* | | |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Lesson | Speech acts | Grammar |
| ***Leçon 1*** *Parisiens, qui êtes vous ?* *(Parisians, who are you)* | - Introducing one’s neighborhood - Talking about other people s life | - Relative pronouns :qui / que - Demonstrative pronouns : celui-ci, celle-ci |
| ***Leçon 2*** *Elle est où la différence ?* *(Where’s the difference ?)* | - Describing people - Talking about style and fashion | - Adjectives : place and agreement - Demonstrative pronouns : celui qui, celui que |
| ***Leçon 3*** *Une minute pour un projet* *(One minute for a project)* | - Introducing and presenting a project - Talking about one’s dreams and objectives | - Conditionnel présent (révision) - Interrogative pronoun : lequel, laquelle |
| ***Leçon 5*** *C’est comment chez vous?* *(How is your Home ?)* | -Talking anout one’s accommodation | -Relative pronouns : où/dont - Verb: *faire* (present tense) - Question structure with *est-ce que* - Gender of Noun.- Verb: faire (present tense) - Question structure with est-ce que - Gender of Noun. |
| **Leçon 6** *Une journée particulière* *(A special day)* | -Talking about living environment, urban life - Comparing | - Comparison - Agreement in number and gender of adjectives - Possessive pronouns. |
| **Leçon 7** Plein sud (Go South !) | - Describing and comparing living environments - Talking about accommodation | - Superlatives - Adjectives |
| **Leçon** **9** *De bonnes résolutions* *(Make a resolution)* | - Making wishes, projects - Making decisions to change habits - Expressing conditions | - Tense: conditionnal - Conditionnal / Si+imparfait - Indefinite adjectives |
| **Leçon** **10** *Au régime !* *(A Diet)* | - Sharing experiences - Expressing a problem, an issue - Looking for advice | - Pronouns: en, y - Indefinite pronouns |
| **Leçon** **11** *Demain, j’arrête …* *(tomorrow I stop)* | - Talking about goals - Giving advise, suggesting solutions | - Devoir + V. infinitif -Tense: subjonctive |
| ***Leçon*** ***27*** *Questions de valeur* *(questions of values)* | - Expressing and qualifying one’s feelings | - Revision of the subjonctive present - Expressions using subjunctive and infinitive |
| **Leçon 14** *A mi-temps* *(Half time)* | - Expressing a restriction | - Adverb using <ment> - Negation (lesson 17) |
| ***Leçon 19*** *Destination week-end* *(Destination for weekend)* | - Talking about one’s leisure activities | - Gerund -Expressions of chronological difference between 2 actions (lesson 30) -En train de + V.infinitif |
| ***Leçon 21*** *Heureux, qui comme Ulysse…* *(Happy as Ulysse)* | - Telling a story using past tense - Talking about a trip, past experience… | - Passé composé (revision) - Passé composé “avoir”: ageement of the past participle |
| ***Leçon 25*** *Réussir sa vie* *(Succeed one’s life)* | - Report a speech, questions, and answers - Taking stock of one s life | - Indirect speech / present tense |

courses.subject: FREN
courses.title: French through Short Films
courses.description: This course aims to strengthen and expand students’ language skills like speaking, listening, writing and reading. This will allow students to have better understanding of French culture and current French societal tendency. It places special emphasis on conversational fluency, grammatical accuracy and vocabulary acquisition. The course is mainly designed from several awarded shorts films and one movie. TV commercials and short videos will be used as supplementary materials. These pedagogical resources will provide the basis for interactive class activities that will help students to develop their language skills and to build language confidence. The course also aims to enhance students’ critical analysis on popular beliefs like clichés about France.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
Prerequisite: FREN3000,3001,3002,3050 or 3051
Not for students who have taken FREN3100 in 2nd term 2019-20
courses.learning_outcomes:
After taking this course student are expected to
• engage and participate in oral discussion on diverse topics.
• gain the cultural knowledge and vocabulary on these topics.
• develop the ability to defend their opinion.
• Improve the ability to understand spoken French language and to reuse them.
courses.course_syllabus:
| **Unit** | **Speech acts** | **Theme** | **Grammar** | **Culture** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1.**Je suis timide** **(I am shy)** | -Expressing one’s tastes -Proposing outings -Describing personality -Giving advices | **Falling in love** | - *Ce que…c’est / Ce qui…* *C’est* *- informal questions* *- futur proche* *-si +verb, + verb* | **Difference of three living style by couple** |
| 2.**L’assistant** **(the assistant)** | -Describing a person -Giving an order -Expression regrets | **Progress of technology and our life** | -Le passé composé (past tense) -L’imperatif ( Imperative) -Verbe devoir (must) -le conditionnel passé (past conditional) | **connected objects** |
| 3. **Bienvenue chez les ch’tis (Welcome to** **chit’s home)** | -Expressing an opinion -Expressing a doubt | **Clichés / stereotypes** | - Revision *Ce que…c’est / Ce qui…* *C’est* -Je pense que / je trouve que/ Je ne suis pas sûr de + a verb | **-Clichés about the North of France by southerners** |

courses.subject: FREN
courses.title: Special Topics in French
courses.description: This course aims at furthering students' understanding of selected area(s) of French language, literature or culture. Topics will vary from year to year. Offerings with different subtitles can be taken up for credit, up to a maximum of two times.
courses.learning_outcomes:
At the end of this course, students demonstrate the ability to:

- undertake projects that integrate the insights of language and culture studies.

- discuss and analyse language phenomena, literary productions or cultural representations of French.

- make use of their linguistic, literary or cultural knowledge to critically assess and evaluate productions and representations in French language, literature and culture.
courses.course_syllabus: This course aims at furthering students' understanding of selected area(s) of French language, literature or culture. Topics will vary from year to year. However, students cannot take courses with the same course code more than once in a single term.

courses.subject: FREN
courses.title: French Through Literature
courses.description: This course aims at enhancing the student’s command in reading and writing of French through the study of French literary works. Through activities such as creative writing, drama performance, role-playing and group discussion, students will familiarize themselves with different literary forms (poems, novels, plays, etc.) in French. The course also aims at enriching student’s general knowledge about French literary culture and allowing them to explore the writings of selected famous French authors in the specific context of their historical/biographical and cultural background. Students will be exposed to selected works through multimedia such as movies, voice recordings, songs and visual illustrations.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
Pre-requisite(s): FREN3000,3050,3001,3002,3051 or equivalent competence
Not for students who have taken FREN3100 in 2016-17
courses.learning_outcomes:
At the completion of this course the students will be able to :
• Write in French in a creative and more elaborative way to express their ideas.
• Have a better reading ability in French.
• Recognize the main elements of literary genres such as poetry, novel and plays and assess their significance.
• Place authors and literary text in their cultural and historical context and be able to analyze texts from different genres.
• Students will be able to comprehend and respond with an enhanced command of French in reading and writing and a heightened cultural awareness.
courses.course_syllabus:
| **Unit** | **Objectives** | **Themes** | **Culture** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Unit I **La Poésie pour parler de soi.** *(Introducing oneself in a form of poetry)* | -Introducing and writing about oneself through diverse poetical forms. -Exploring and getting familiar with a variety of forms of poems. -Writing by imitating or by following precise instructions. -Having some knowledge about History of poetry and some major French poets. -Developping a personal understanding of some selected major French Poems. -Classifying poetry in historical context. | -Likes and dislikes. -Hobbies. -Childhood and adulthood. -Family. -Wishes and hopes. -Time. | -20th century Surrealism. -Calligraphy in poetry. -Popular and famous poems and poets of the XIX and XXth century. -Classic poems from Jean de La Fontaine (XVIIe). |
| Unit II **Le Roman pour évoquer la rencontre.** *(Exploring Novel through scenes of encounter)* | -Reading and understanding dialogues. -Writing a narrative text. -Relating past experiences. -Creating characters and write a text about their first encounter. -Accepting, refusing a making proposals. -Defining words. -Expressing feelings. | -Love and friendship. -The issue of being different/tolerance. -Childhood. -Family. | -XXe Major Novels such as *The Little Prince* by Saint Exupery or *L’Amant* by Marguerite Duras. -Discovering *Exercises of Styles* by Raymond Queneau. -XIXe Romantism (Victor Hugo’s *Notre Dame*) and Realism (Guy de Maupassant’s short story *Simon’s father*). |
| Unit III **Le Théâtre : l’interaction et la communication.** *(Exploring interaction and communication issue through theater through plays)* | -Exploring several genre such as comedy and tragedy and the theater of the Absurd. -Discovering the characteristics and specificity of a theatrical text and its representation on stage. -Analyzing and performing a passage of a play related to the issue of communication. -By imitation or by following precise instruction, writing a theatrical text and perform it. -Understanding the issue of some scenes taken from various French plays and deepen their understanding. | -Comic situation due to misunderstandings. -Education. -Morals and family matters. | -XXe Theater of the Absurd : *The Lesson* by Ionesco, *The Misunderstanding* by Albert Camus, *Waiting for Godot* by Samuel Beckett. -XXe *Antigone* by Jean Anouilh. -XIXe *Dindon* by George Feydeau. -XVIIe Molière’s *The Middle class Gentlemen.* |
